articles.headline: VW Argued for Easing New E.U. Tests on Emissions
articles.snippet: New tests, meant to more closely reflect real-world driving conditions, are to take effect in 2017. But they face opposition in the European Parliament.
articles.abstract: New tests, meant to more closely reflect real-world driving conditions, are to take effect in 2017. But they face opposition in the European Parliament.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Volkswagen successfully lobbied to remove two key parts of Europe’s forthcoming auto emissions tests, an internal email shows, including a provision to measure the significant pollution released when an engine is started but hasn’t yet warmed up.
articles.byline: By Danny Hakim and Claire Barthelemy

articles.headline: Mayor Rahm Emanuel Fires Chicago Police Superintendent
articles.snippet: The superintendent, Garry F. McCarthy, and his department came under pressure for resisting the release of a video showing an officer shooting a teenager 16 times.
articles.abstract: The superintendent, Garry F. McCarthy, and his department came under pressure for resisting the release of a video showing an officer shooting a teenager 16 times.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — A week ago, Mayor Rahm Emanuel and Police Superintendent Garry F. McCarthy stood together, shoulder to shoulder, as this city released long-sought video of a white police officer shooting a black teenager 16 times along a Chicago street last year. But after nights of demonstration that followed the video’s release and growing calls for changes at the city’s Police Department and beyond, Mr. Emanuel stood alone at a lectern on Tuesday to say that he had dismissed Mr. McCarthy.
articles.byline: By Monica Davey and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: Puerto Rico Begins Choosing Which Debt Payments to Make
articles.snippet: The island met payments due on Tuesday, as officials testified before a Senate panel considering whether to give the island bankruptcy protection.
articles.abstract: The island met payments due on Tuesday, as officials testified before a Senate panel considering whether to give the island bankruptcy protection.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Puerto Rico avoided its first major default by making payments of $354 million on its debt on Tuesday, but the island’s governor said that he had already taken steps to halt certain payments on other debt coming due on Jan. 1.

articles.headline: For Robert Dear, Religion and Rage Before Planned Parenthood Attack
articles.snippet: Mr. Dear was a man of religious conviction who sinned openly, and a man who craved both extreme solitude and female company. Some women say he abused them.
articles.abstract: Mr. Dear was a man of religious conviction who sinned openly, and a man who craved both extreme solitude and female company. Some women say he abused them.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — The man she had married professed to be deeply religious. But after more than seven years with Robert L. Dear Jr., Barbara Micheau had come to see life with him as a kind of hell on earth.

articles.headline: Imagining a World Without Growth
articles.snippet: To deflect climate change, some experts say the economic growth afforded by ample, cheap fossil fuel must stop. But could the planet survive without growing?
articles.abstract: To deflect climate change, some experts say the economic growth afforded by ample, cheap fossil fuel must stop. But could the planet survive without growing?
articles.lead_paragraph: Could the world order survive without growing?

articles.headline: G.O.P. Candidates Viewing Economy’s Past Through Gold-Colored Glasses
articles.snippet: Some Republican presidential hopefuls have urged a return to the gold standard to restrain government spending, but experts say it’s not that simple.
articles.abstract: Some Republican presidential hopefuls have urged a return to the gold standard to restrain government spending, but experts say it’s not that simple.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republicans unhappy with the Federal Reserve are circulating an idea that long ago lost currency with most economists: a gold standard.

articles.headline: Students’ Protests May Play Role in Supreme Court Case on Race in Admissions
articles.snippet: The protests, some at the alma maters of the court’s members, might sway the justices in a University of Texas case where a white woman was denied entrance.
articles.abstract: The protests, some at the alma maters of the court’s members, might sway the justices in a University of Texas case where a white woman was denied entrance.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As student protests over racial injustice are exploding at campuses across the nation, the Supreme Court is preparing to hear a major case that could put an end to racial preferences in college admissions.

articles.headline: Mark Zuckerberg Vows to Donate 99% of His Facebook Shares for Charity
articles.snippet: The plan, involving a new organization to manage the money, was made by the Facebook chief executive in an open letter to his newborn daughter, Max.
articles.abstract: The plan, involving a new organization to manage the money, was made by the Facebook chief executive in an open letter to his newborn daughter, Max.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder and chief executive of Facebook, announced on Tuesday that he and his wife would give 99 percent of their Facebook shares “during our lives” — holdings currently worth more than $45 billion — to charitable purposes.
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: Whistle-Blower Complaint Directed at Whistle-Blower Group
articles.snippet: Documents show that late last year, the National Whistleblowers Center settled charges by two former employees of unfair labor practices.
articles.abstract: Documents show that late last year, the National Whistleblowers Center settled charges by two former employees of unfair labor practices.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Lindsey Williams lost her job, the news arrived abruptly, in a voice mail message from her boss. A co-worker, Richard Renner, said he was given just an hour to hand in his keys, collect his personal effects and leave.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Ben Protess

articles.headline: ISIS Promise of Statehood Falling Far Short, Ex-Residents Say
articles.snippet: Cruelty, a lack of services and an onerous tax system are driving people from areas controlled by the Islamic State, challenging its claim of being a government for the world’s Muslims.
articles.abstract: Cruelty, a lack of services and an onerous tax system are driving people from areas controlled by the Islamic State, challenging its claim of being a government for the world’s Muslims.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANLIURFA, Turkey — After the Syrian government stopped paying him, a technician who had spent two decades pumping the country’s oil received an enticing offer: do the same work for the jihadists of the Islamic State — starting at three times the salary.

articles.headline: Yahoo’s Board Is Said to Weigh Selling Off Core Business
articles.snippet: The board of Yahoo will consider major changes during meetings this week, people briefed on the plans said, as well as review plans for the sale of its valuable stake in Alibaba.
articles.abstract: The board of Yahoo will consider major changes during meetings this week, people briefed on the plans said, as well as review plans for the sale of its valuable stake in Alibaba.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The board of Yahoo will discuss potentially selling off the beleaguered Internet company’s core business during a series of meetings this week, people briefed on the plans said on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Vindu Goel

articles.headline: NATO Unveils Plans to Grow, Drawing Fury and Threats From Russia
articles.snippet: The alliance’s decision to invite Montenegro to join drew an angry response from Russia and added another layer of complication to efforts to resolve the crisis in Syria.
articles.abstract: The alliance’s decision to invite Montenegro to join drew an angry response from Russia and added another layer of complication to efforts to resolve the crisis in Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For the first time in six years, NATO on Wednesday invited a new member to join the military alliance, prompting a heated response from Russia and further underscoring escalating tensions between the Cold War adversaries.

articles.headline: Wages Up, Prices Low: Shake Shack’s Food for Thought for the Fed
articles.snippet: Wages for restaurant workers are generally going up, but consumer price inflation seems far from a problem.
articles.abstract: Wages for restaurant workers are generally going up, but consumer price inflation seems far from a problem.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Federal Reserve officials meet in two weeks to decide whether to raise interest rates, they will probably eat catered food at their Foggy Bottom headquarters. If they want to get some fresh air, though, they might consider heading to the nearest Shake Shack, where they could find both tasty burgers and insight that will make their decision smarter.
